discussion.content: if switches are already connected MDF-IDF setup then 802.1Q (aka Dot1q)is needed so l3 device is required base on answers pick router to be correct. Happy testing
communication between two different networks - router needed

questions.question_text: A network technician is able to connect the switches between two offices, but the offices cannot communicate with each other, as each office uses a different IP addressing scheme. Which of the following devices needs to be installed between the switches to allow communication?
An attacker quickly gains administrative access to a network device. Which of the following MOST likely allowed the attacker to guess the password?

discussion.content: Never heard of rainbow tables until now.

"Rainbow Tables are basically huge sets of precomputed tables filled with hash values that are pre-matched to possible plaintext passwords. The Rainbow Tables essentially allow hackers to reverse the hashing function to determine what the plaintext password might be."
https://www.lifewire.com/rainbow-tables-your-passwords-worst-nightmare-2487288
Rainbow tables can crack a password faster than brute force or dictionary attacks can. So I'd say the answer is indeed rainbow tables as it is the MOST likely method used to crack the password.

CompTIA A+
Bruteforce, dictionary, rainbow table
why would this not be a brute-force attack?

questions.question_text: A switch vendor recently released a patch to fix a critical vulnerability found in its switch OS. Which of the following should a network administrator do NEXT according to best practices?

discussion.content: Always remember: The real word <> CompTIA. You must intentionally enter an alternate reality when you go to pass the exam.
This is not the network admin responsibility! It is the vendorâ€™s, but what an admin can do is install the patch with a rollback plan

Cmon u knew what answer will be.

Do u still after 600 question doubt or did 5 questions in tasks confuse you ... ðŸ˜†

choices.D: Choose a single production switch and pilot the patch.
choices.B: Put the patch into production immediately.
choices.C: Put the patch into production with a rollback plan.
choices.A: Test the patch in a test environment.
choices.E: Put the patch into production at the next maintenance window.

questions.question_text: A company requires a network storage solution that allows for the use of OS-specific credentials and permissions. The company purchases a SOHO solution, which includes support for SMB, iSCSI, FTP, Telnet, and NFS natively out of the box. Which of the following should be done FIRST?

discussion.content: Don't know how I feel about this question but after rereading it a few times seems that c is probably correct.. "straight out of the box" implying it's new, verify user credentials would be rather useless generate new keys and certs is void, hash files, well they are not downloading nothing since those features are out of the box.. c from process of elimination

choices.D: Hash files that will be stored.
